sources.name: Perceptions of spending on health expenditure- IPSOS
sources.description:
Data published by Ipsos MORI Perils of Perception Study 2016
Link https://www.ipsos.com/ipsos-mori/en-uk/perceptions-are-not-reality-what-world-gets-wrong
Retrieved 2017-06-15

Ipsos MORI conducted 27,250 interviews across 50 countries between September-November 2016 via the Ipsos MORI Online Panel system. In the Czech Republic, Montenegro, Netherlands, Norway and Serbia, interviews were carried out through a combination of the online system and face-to-face methodologies.

Data are weighted to match the profile of the population.

variables.name: How much we think we spend on health expenditure
variables.description: Percentage of GDP the average person thinks its country spends on health expenditure per year

variables.name: How much we actually spend on health expenditure
variables.description: Percentage of GDP we actually spend on health expenditure per year
